sentences.en: A raised roadway , as across water or marshland.
sentences.cn: 一种在水上或沙滩或沼泽上的通道.

sentences.en: At Honghu Lake, fish spawning has been affected, said Zeng Xiaodong, leader of the Honghu marshland management office.
sentences.cn: 另据洪湖沼泽管理办公室的曾晓东介绍，洪湖的鱼类的产卵量也受到了很大影响。

sentences.en: Crews are deployed the in Lake Barre to clean land marshland hit by oil residuleresidueresidue.
sentences.cn: 工作人员正在巴尔湖上清理受石油残留物侵蚀的沼泽地.

sentences.en: Designed by architect Lord Norman Foster –who created the new Wembley Stadium –the airport would be a modern-day feat of British engineering built on reclaimed marshland.
sentences.cn: 该机场由建筑大师诺曼·福斯特爵士设计建造——他曾设计了新温布利球场——机场将建造在开垦过的沼泽地上，这也是现代英国建筑工程的一大壮举。

sentences.en: In the long March, our Red Army soldiers succeeded in wading through the marshland.
sentences.cn: 长征中, 我们的红军战士成功地涉过了沼泽地.

sentences.en: In the past, this was a piece of marshland with little trace of human habitation.
sentences.cn: 在过去这里是一片沮泽,少有人烟.

sentences.en: Originally, it was a stretch of marshland.
sentences.cn: 这里原本是一片泥泞的浅海滩.

sentences.en: The engineers carried the highway across the marshland.
sentences.cn: 工程师们把公路延长通过沼泽地带.

sentences.en: They made a map of the marshland.
sentences.cn: 他们绘制了一张沼泽地的地图.

sentences.en: You can't actually drink the water from the marshland. But you can distil it.
sentences.cn: 沼泽地的水不能饮用，但是可以将它蒸馏净化。

trans.tran_en: an area of low wet ground that is always soft
